5. An upcoming windfall tax will be considered. This proposed tax will be on oil company profits, which could then be returned back to hardworking Californians.

1. The state is immediately moving to relax the winter fuel rules. Consumers should expect gas prices to drop by 15-20 cents per gallon and more gas supply will become available…

Grants would be awarded to individuals who work with youth in two settings - counselors who work directly for School Districts and community based organizations.

Again, none of this would be advancing without the work of @TonyThurmond and the amazing team at @CADeptEd.

Those who receive the grant must commit to a minimum of two years of public service.

This bill takes a needs based strategy: Areas where there are higher cases of Adverse Childhood Experiences and/or lack of mental health professionals - would receive priority funding…
$250 million would fund 10,000 grants of up to $25,000 all geared toward recruiting mental health professionals into schools and communities of need…

The total investment for this program would be $250 million over the next three years.

We’ll be working with the Superintendent to secure the funding…

The legislation will establish a program to provide 10,000 grants for aspiring mental health professionals who commit to serving kids and youth at California public schools and community-based organizations…
That’s why, we’re introducing a crucial bill with Superintendent Thurmond, SB 1229 (the Superintendent has been a true champion on this important issue)…

Yes, you can still drop off your ballot at your local Registrar of Voters Office. Or, drop off your ballot in a secure drop box. Please check-in with your local Registrar of Voters on drop box availability.

3. When does the ballot postmark need to be dated in order for my vote to be counted?

Your ballot needs to be postmarked by #ElectionDay (Tuesday, November 3) and received no later than 17 days after the Election.

2. When is the last day to register to #vote? 

Your registration must be postmarked or submitted electronically no later than October 19, 2020. You can register or re-register to vote online here: https://t.co/E2KVbFIx92

1. Do I need to put a stamp on the return envelope of my ballot?

All vote-by-mail ballots in California come with prepaid postage. You just need to drop your sealed envelope (with your ballot inside) in the nearest mailbox.
Here’s are some quick answers to frequently asked questions...
